reviews.review_msg: She doesn't use a textbook. Her notes are exactly same as ETH Zurich University Onur Mutlu. I also don't like her notes or teaching. Impossible to get a deep understanding in class and zero sources. Overall bad experience, I did not learn anything in any course I took with her. I don't think she cares at all, just wanna rake in the SFU green dough.

Anita is by far one of the best professors I have had, if not the best.

We had a lot of difficult material to cover, expect to be working a little too hard. But you come out of that class with a lot of useful knowledge.

You will have to pay attention in class, which is pretty easy considering she tries to make the class entertaining, 10/10 jokes.

She is by far the most caring prof I have ever taken a class with. She remembers her students, calls them by their names, very helpful outside of the class even not on her office hours she is ready to be helpful in any topic,a general advice, personal problem to share, help with projects. I wish every prof was like her.The class is difficult though

Young and hip professor who is very approachable and knowledgeable of the topic. Very comprehensive class with many different topics and long labs to practice theory. This is the peak of the VLSI stream of classes for undergrad so if you want to work in the industry then pay close attention to the teachings (I did and it landed me a job in CompE).

ENSC 252 is a hard course and the midterms are hell (the year I took it the average on midterm 2 was 39% before the scale). Anita is a great lecturer and super helpful during labs and Paige is an awesome and approachable TA. Be prepared to a heck ton of work for just a decent grade because the course is that hard.
I love Anita. She's great.
Anita is the best prof in the engineering department
One of the best profs in SFU engineering, but don't confuse that with the course being easy. But in the end you really feel that you've learned useful and important things from the course.

Dr. Tino did a great job in a remote semester, lectures were clear and concise. She was available around the clock for help with labs and course content. She gave me great career advice as well. People complaining about the lab clearly didn't read through the lab or ask for help (TA, discussion boards, etc.).
Does not explain anything about lab.

An Engineering prof that really tries to help students learn, is nice, funny, and doesn't get enjoying from watching the suffering of students... Is she really real...? Am I going to wake up and realize it was just a dream...?

Anita's a great prof! She really goes above and beyond for her students - she's very willing to help outside of class, and she's also really fun to talk to. The course itself is insanely hard, but I couldn't imagine how hard it'd be without a prof as good as Anita.
The course is pretty difficult with weekly labs, assignment and pre lab assignments but she really does a good job in making students understand the course. Shes the best!

one of my all time favourite profs, she is not only smart and great at what she does, she explains concepts in understandable ways and cares about her students much more than others. you will definitely have to work for the labs, assignments, etc. and its not easy but she makes it fun. super funny and loves the raptors
Not a morning person. Dopest Prof tho.

I made an account after 6 years of uni just so I could give this rating. Anita is fantastic. She knows the subject matter like the back of her hand, and is able to relay the info clearly and concisely. Going to lectures is a must, but taking notes is not. Also, choose the same core as everyone else for the project. Don't make life hard for yourself

she is awesome, super chill, hard core Raptors fan, hates oranges. One of the best professors in Computer Engineering. She knows how to teach and how to make students pay attention to the class, very helpful in the lab.
Great professor!

Very chill, funny, and generally cool. Her lectures are great, but you will still need to read the textbook. That's more a reflection on the coursework than on her not teaching enough. I'd definitely take more classes with her.

Tends to rely heavily on the lecture content for exam material. Has weekly assigned readings that are used both in the lecture and lab components of the course. Fairly nice with the grading scheme, offering up a substantial part of your overall grade for just completing labs, readings, and assignments. Exams tend to be tricky but fair.
Well organized, cares about her students, and really funny! She brightens up the day and teaches some neat stuff
